name: embelin
Reason: Embelin is a complex molecule with multiple functional groups that can impact its melting point. The basic unit of analysis is the benzene ring, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The presence of multiple methoxy groups (MeO) can increase the melting point due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces, estimated at around +10°C per methoxy group. The phenyl group (C6H5) can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity, estimated at around +30°C. The carbonyl group (C=O) can form hydrogen bonds and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +20°C. The ether linkage (–O–) can lower the melting point due to reduced molecular weight and reduced hydrogen bonding, estimated at around -5°C. Finally, the presence of a dioxane-like bridging moiety can contribute to the melting point, estimated at around +5°C.
